metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: SVG Clipping and Masking
SVG Clipping and Masking
SVG elements can be clipped and masked.
content.html: SVG elements can be clipped and masked.

content.text: The <clipPath> element is used to clip an SVG element.
content.html: The <clipPath> element is used to clip an SVG element.

content.text: The <mask> element is used to apply a mask to an SVG element.
content.html: The <mask> element is used to apply a mask to an SVG element.

content.text: SVG Clipping
Clipping is when you remove a part from an element.
content.html: Clipping is when you remove a part from an element.

content.text: For clipping, we use the <clipPath> element.
content.html: For clipping, we use the <clipPath> element.

content.text: Every path/element inside a <clipPath> element is inspected and evaluated. Then every part of the target that lies OUTSIDE of this area will NOT be rendered. In other words: Anything outside the path is hidden and anything inside is shown!
content.html: Every path/element inside a <clipPath> element is inspected and evaluated. Then every part of the target that lies OUTSIDE of this area will NOT be rendered. In other words: Anything outside the path is hidden and anything inside is shown!

content.text: The <clipPath> element is usually placed in a <defs> section.
content.html: The <clipPath> element is usually placed in a <defs> section.

content.text: Let's look at some examples:
content.html: Let's look at some examples:

content.text: In this example, we create a red circle centered at (50,50), with radius 50:
content.html: In this example, we create a red circle centered at (50,50), with radius 50:

content.text: Here is the SVG code:
content.html: Here is the SVG code:

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="100" 
fill="red"
/>
</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="100" fill="red" />
</svg>

content.text: Now we add a <clipPath> element with a single <rect> element. This <rect> element would cover the UPPER HALF of the circle. The <rect> will NOT be drawn; Instead, its size and position will be used to determine which pixels of the circle that will be shown. Since the rectangle covers only the upper half of the circle, the lower half of the circle will vanish:
content.html: Now we add a <clipPath> element with a single <rect> element. This <rect> element would cover the UPPER HALF of the circle. The <rect> will NOT be drawn; Instead, its size and position will be used to determine which pixels of the circle that will be shown. Since the rectangle covers only the upper half of the circle, the lower half of the circle will vanish:

content.text: Here is the SVG code:
content.html: Here is the SVG code:

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  
<defs>
    <clipPath id="cut-bottom">
      
<rect x="0" y="0" width="200" height="50" />
    </clipPath>
  
</defs>
  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="100" 
fill="red" clip-path="url(#cut-bottom)"
/>
</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <clipPath id="cut-bottom">
      <rect x="0" y="0" width="200" height="50" />
    </clipPath>
  </defs>
  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="100" fill="red" clip-path="url(#cut-bottom)" />
</svg>

content.text: SVG Masking
For masking, we use the <mask> element.
content.html: For masking, we use the <mask> element.

content.text: The <mask> element is used to apply a mask to an SVG element.
content.html: The <mask> element is used to apply a mask to an SVG element.

content.text: A mask is referenced with the mask attribute.
content.html: A mask is referenced with the mask attribute.

content.text: Here is a simple mask example:
content.html: Here is a simple mask example:

content.text: Here is the SVG code:
content.html: Here is the SVG code:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" 
  mask="url(#mask1)" />

x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" 
  mask="url(#mask1)" /

<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" 
  height="100" fill="none" stroke="black" />

x="0" y="0" width="100" 
  height="100" fill="none" stroke="black" /

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="120" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    
<mask id="mask1">
      <rect x="0" y="0" 
width="100" height="50" fill="white" />
    </mask>
  
</defs>
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
fill="red"
mask="url(#mask1)" />
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" 
height="100" fill="none" stroke="black" />
</svg>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" 
  mask="url(#mask1)" />

x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" 
  mask="url(#mask1)" /

<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" 
  height="100" fill="none" stroke="black" />

x="0" y="0" width="100" 
  height="100" fill="none" stroke="black" /

content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="120" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <mask id="mask1">
      <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="50" fill="white" />
    </mask>
  </defs>
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" fill="red" mask="url(#mask1)" />
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" fill="none" stroke="black" />
</svg>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" 
  mask="url(#mask1)" />

x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" 
  mask="url(#mask1)" /

<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" 
  height="100" fill="none" stroke="black" />

x="0" y="0" width="100" 
  height="100" fill="none" stroke="black" /

content.text: The example above defines a mask with id="mask1" . Inside the <mask> element there is a <rect> element. This <rect> element defines the shape of the mask.
content.html: The example above defines a mask with id="mask1". Inside the <mask> element there is a <rect> element. This <rect> element defines the shape of the mask.

content.text: The example also defines a <rect> element which uses the mask. The mask is referenced with the mask attribute.
content.html: The example also defines a <rect> element which uses the mask. The mask is referenced with the mask attribute.

content.text: The red rectangle should be 100 pixels high, but only the first 50 pixels vertically are visible. This is because the mask rectangle is only 50 pixels high. The rectangle is only visible in the parts covered by the mask rectangle.
content.html: The red rectangle should be 100 pixels high, but only the first 50 pixels vertically are visible. This is because the mask rectangle is only 50 pixels high. The rectangle is only visible in the parts covered by the mask rectangle.

content.text: The last <rect> element is just to show the size of the rectangle without the mask.
content.html: The last <rect> element is just to show the size of the rectangle without the mask.

content.text: Here is another example that uses a <circle> element to define the shape of the mask:
content.html: Here is another example that uses a <circle> element to define the shape of the mask:

content.text: Here is the SVG code:
content.html: Here is the SVG code:

syntaxHighlighting.text: <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" fill="red" mask="url(#mask2)" />
x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" fill="red" mask="url(#mask2)" /
<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" stroke="black" fill="none"/>
x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" stroke="black" fill="none"/

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="120" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    
<mask id="mask2">
      <circle cx="50" cy="50" 
r="30" fill="white" />
    </mask>
  </defs>
  
<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" fill="red" mask="url(#mask2)" />
  
<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" stroke="black" fill="none"/>
</svg>

syntax_highlighting.text: <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" fill="red" mask="url(#mask2)" />
x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" fill="red" mask="url(#mask2)" /
<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" stroke="black" fill="none"/>
x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" stroke="black" fill="none"/

content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="120" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <mask id="mask2">
      <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="30" fill="white" />
    </mask>
  </defs>
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" fill="red" mask="url(#mask2)" />
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" stroke="black" fill="none"/>
</svg>

syntax_highlighting_data.text: <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" fill="red" mask="url(#mask2)" />
x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" fill="red" mask="url(#mask2)" /
<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" stroke="black" fill="none"/>
x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" stroke="black" fill="none"/

content.text: Fill Color and Opacity
The fill color of the elements inside the <mask> element defines the opacity of the fill color of the element that refers to the mask.
content.html: The fill color of the elements inside the <mask> element defines the opacity of the fill color of the element that refers to the mask.

content.text: In the examples above we have only used fill="white". In a mask, white is treated as an area that will be shown, and black is treated as an area to be masked.
content.html: In the examples above we have only used fill="white". In a mask, white is treated as an area that will be shown, and black is treated as an area to be masked.

content.text: A mask will be more opaque the closer the color is to #ffffff (white) and more transparent the closer the color is to #000000 (black):
content.html: A mask will be more opaque the closer the color is to #ffffff (white) and more transparent the closer the color is to #000000 (black):

content.text: Here is the SVG code:
content.html: Here is the SVG code:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" mask=" url(#mask3)"/>

x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" mask=" url(#mask3)"/

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="120" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    
<mask id="mask3">
      <rect 
x="0" y="0" width="100" height="30" fill="#232323" />
      
<rect x="0" y="30" width="100" height="40" fill="#454545" />
      
<rect x="0" y="70" width="100" height="30" fill="#878787" /> 
    
</mask>
  </defs>
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
fill="red" mask=" url(#mask3)"/>
</svg>

<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" mask=" url(#mask3)"/>

x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" mask=" url(#mask3)"/

content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="120" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <mask id="mask3">
      <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="30" fill="#232323" />
      <rect x="0" y="30" width="100" height="40" fill="#454545" />
      <rect x="0" y="70" width="100" height="30" fill="#878787" />
    </mask>
  </defs>
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" fill="red" mask=" url(#mask3)"/>
</svg>

content.text: Gradients in Masks
In this example the mask shape uses a gradient as a fill color:
content.html: In this example the mask shape uses a gradient as a fill color:

content.text: Here is the SVG code:
content.html: Here is the SVG code:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" mask=" url(#mask4)"/>

x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" mask=" url(#mask4)"/

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="120" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    
<linearGradient id="gradient1">
      <stop 
offset="0%" stop-color="#ffffff" />
      <stop 
offset="100%" stop-color="#000000" />
    </linearGradient>
    
<mask id="mask4">
      <rect x="0" y="0" 
width="100" height="100" fill="url(#gradient1)" /> 
    
</mask>
  </defs>
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
fill="red" mask=" url(#mask4)"/>
</svg>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" mask=" url(#mask4)"/>

x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" 
  fill="red" mask=" url(#mask4)"/

content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="120" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <linearGradient id="gradient1">
      <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#ffffff" />
      <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#000000" />
    </linearGradient>
    <mask id="mask4">
      <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" fill="url(#gradient1)" />
    </mask>
  </defs>
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100" fill="red" mask=" url(#mask4)"/>
</svg>
